newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy's Impregilo pays div,sees better 97.
newsitem.headline: Italy's Impregilo pays div,sees better 97.

text.p: Italian construction group Impregilo said it will pay a 30 lire dividend per savings share after returning to the black in 1996 and sees even better results for this year.
In February, when the group announced it made a net profit of 11.2 billion lire in 1996 after four years of losses, it had said it did not plan to pay out a dividend.

Impregilo said in a statement that after posting consolidated revenue of around 600 billion lire in the first quarter of 1997, it forecast a further improvement in results for the full year due to growth in operating margins and the reduction of financial charges.
"A further, if only slight, improvement in full-year results is expected," Chairman Franco Carraro said.
So far this year, the company had won new orders for around 400 billion lire, of which 20 percent were from Italy and 30 percent from European Union countries.
